result.execSummary:
The defendant Briana Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Ms. Krueger to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with any other sentence in being.

Cases 14CF435 and 14CM477 called at 1:14pm [mo]
Defendant Briana Krueger in court, in custody with Attorney Bradley J Jansen.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance in both cases and submits a victim impact statement.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Krueger

As to Case 14CF435:
Ms. Krueger waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

As to Case 14CF435:
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Krueger guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Ms. Krueger to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with any other sentence in being. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision: 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations per agent
--no possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling  as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/ maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no presence at any Wal-Mart store
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given

As to Case 14CM477:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail; to commence forthwith and concurrent to any sentence in being (to be served in WPS with other sentences)
--0 days credit for time already served given
-- A Civil Judgement is granted in favor of Mr. Mendez in the amount of $385 for restitution
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443 to be entered as civil judgement


The Court finds that Ms. Krueger has already submitted a DNA sample and therefore does not order her to do so again. 
recess: 1:55pm
NOH for Defendant sent to LKA//Def. in custody
Proposed order to produce
Waiver of Prelim on April 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Cases 14CF435 and 14CM477 called at 3:00pm [mo]
Defendant Briana Krueger appears via video conferencing from WPS, Her Attorney Bradley J Jansen appears in court. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Atty. Jansen indicates that this case is only an in-person sentencing hearing away from a resolution. The Defense is prepared to waive Preliminary Hearing today by videoconferencing.
The Court indicates that it would prefer to do the Waiver of Prelim, Arraignment, and Plea and Sentencing all on the same date, when Ms. Krueger is in person.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 

recess: 3:12pm

NEXT: Plea & Sentencing/ Arraignment/ Waiver of Prelim: 4/21/15 at 1:00pm
NOH sent to def LKA//def in custody
State's with Cover Letter
Status conference on March 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 25, 2015 at 03:20 pm.

Request for detainer w/fax confirmation
Fax Transmittal w/confirmation attached
Bond applies to both Cases #14CF435 and #14CM477.

case#14CF435 and #14CM477 called at 2:13pm. [MK]
Defendant Briana Krueger appears via videoconferencing from the Taycheedah Correctional Institution, in custody. Her counsel, Attorney Bradley Jansen appears in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

In both cases, Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the felony charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds that Probable Cause exists in each of the Criminal Complaints. 
In Case #14CF435: Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
In Case #14CM477:  Plea of "not guilty" is entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defense.


The Court requires a single $3,000 signature bond, which applies to both cases, with the conditions:
--no presence at any Walmart Store
--not to be on the block in which the residence where the Criminal Damage occurred is located [1025 Clement Street, Watertown WI]
--this bond only needs to be signed by Ms. Krueger if she is being released from custody [before she is released from custody]. 
recess 2:26pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/25 at 3:20pm   (2) Status Conference on 3/16/15 at 3:00pm- arrangements are to be made for Ms. Krueger to appear via v/c unless Attorney Jansen alerts the Court and the DA that the hearing will be a final hearing, and if so, then the State is to prepare a writ

The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaints.
